description: Change of use of a small House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) (Use Class C4) into a large House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) comprising 7 bedrooms up to 7 people (Use Class Sui Generis)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): Proposed Ground Floor Plan drawing no.PL09 Rev 01, Proposed First Floor Plan drawing no.PL04 Rev 01, Proposed Second Floor Plan drawing no.PL05 Rev 01, Existing Elevation Plan drawing no.PL06 Rev 01, Proposed Elevation Plan drawing no.PL07 Rev 01 and Proposed Section Plan drawing no.PL08 Rev 01
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than seven (7) persons within seven (7) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material and safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies D4 and SI 8 of the London Plan (2021) and 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Seven (7) secured cycle parking spaces shall be implemented in in accordance with the submitted documentation and Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023)(Updated), Ealing's Sustainable Transport SPG 2019 and Ealing's Climate and Ecological Emergency Strategy.
| No cooking facilities shall be installed at any time in any of the rooms. All cooking and preparation of hot food shall take place within the communal kitchens identified on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the HMO rooms are not wholly self-contained and to protect the amenity of the occupants of each of the rooms and neighbouring properties, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Council HMO Licensing Guidelines. | Prior to occupation, the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall contain at least two (2) complete sets of cooking facilities and these shall be retained at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy.

| The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). The sound insulation of the building envelope shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Section 6 of Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building).  The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2023 (Updated) - section 12, policies E7.A.7 DM DPD, Standard 30 of the Housing SPG, Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021, Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19) and Ealing's Noise and Vibration SPG 10

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 10dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms above/below/adjoining communal main entrance, corridor, kitchen/living/dining room and bathroom of separate dwellings. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2023 (Updated) - section 12, policies E7.A.7 DM DPD, Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016, Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19) and Ealing's Noise and Vibration SPG 10.

| The land shall be used for House of Multiple Occupation and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in class Sui Generis of the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7A and 7B, Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19), policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D4, D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided as per approved plan, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021)
